page.title: 09Changing times in Rawmarsh
page.content: Mr Simmonite has lived in Rawmarsh all his life. He was born in{Forge Row on Parkgate but moved when he was four years old to{Peashill St.}He went to {Dale Road School,}now closed, where pupils had to pass exams each year to move up. Children in those days played 'Whip up top' and with cigarette cards and unlike today they had to make their own games which had to be cheap. When he was working Mr Simmonite had 6-7 days holiday per year. When he had saved up enough money he went on a 5 shilling trip to{Blackpool}by train, leaving Parkgate at 11 o'clock and sometimes not getting back until 2 o'clock the next morning. Mr Simmonite has driven since 1939 when 30 mph was a fast speed. His first car was a Morris 8. In those days a car would last for 15-20 years.
